wrcbiologist.name: Bird Conservation Biologist
wrcbiologist.synopsis: Multi-disciplinary biologist working at local, state, national, and international scopes.
wrcbiologist.description:
Provide leadership in state, regional, and national bird conservation initiatives designed to engage the public in bird conservation, provide venues for researcher coordination and collaboration, and assist in multi-organization conservation efforts at state, national, and international scopes.
  • Application for, administration of annual federal grants and other ad hoc grant opportunities
  • Consult on conservation policy development (state species listing, NEPA documentation, Double-crested Cormorant rule, Migratory Bird Treaty Act, strategic planning).
  • Serve on the 2021 Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act grant review team.
  • Led review of bird species for the 2015 Wildlife Action Plan Species of Greatest Conservation Need status using modified guidelines from Salafsky et al 2008.
  • Reviewed species for state listing, applying criteria for measures of resiliency, representation, and redundancy through literature review and spatial and tabular data analysis.

ncpif.name: NC Partners in Flight Coordinator
ncpif.description:
Coordinate meetings of bird researchers in North Carolina and beyond to encourage communication/collaboration/cooperation.
  • Member of leadership team to create the Partners in Flight Eastern Working Group.
  • Member, US North American Bird Conservation Initiative Human Dimensions subcommittee, Social Science Coordinator advisory team; Chair, Communications subcommittee. Assist development of bird conservation messaging including Field Guide to Developing Partnerships and initiatives surrounding the Bringing Birds Back campaign.
  • Vice Co-Chair, Bird- and Fish- Related Conflict Working Group, Member, Bird Conservation Committee, Association of Fish and Wildlife Agencies. Played key role in compiling cohesive feedback from a diverse group of bird and fisheries biologists from across the nation to provide to USFWS staff with actionable distillation of complex conservation issues while developing recent rule regarding take of Double-crested Cormorants (§21.28).
  • Serve on Partners in Flight website management team.
  • Participate in Atlantic Flyway Nongame Technical Section meetings.
  • Developed web resource linking North Carolina birds, associated habitats, projects, organizations, and conservation priorities (wiki.ncpif.org) (ongoing).
  • Use and development of technologies enabling conservation initiatives: interactive web tools, mapping, and data collection.

  • Member, Steering Committee and Science Committee.
  • Chair, Outreach Committee: Guide outreach direction, aiming to engage audiences with diverse skills, background, race, ethnicity, and sexual orientation.

  • Co-development of tools for data evaluation, storage, and ultimately, analysis, including API and website development for review and tracking of eBird Basic Dataset modifications.
  • Developing automated methods to track and gather in-kind volunteer hours to match Federal funding.

ncbt.name: NC Birding Trail Coordinator
ncbt.description:
• Provide leadership for the six-agency cooperative effort designed to promote birding, bird education, and patronage of local businesses.
  • Provide direction and supervise social media and outreach – designed and developed website. Inform public through entertaining and innovative presentations, newsletter, and social media. Over 1,000 newsletter sign-ups within a month.
  • Develop engaging web experience to highlight Trail site locations using web technologies– increased website visitation 79%.
  • Supervise NCBT assistant managing social media and public engagement.
